Package tic_tac_toe

Class AgentLevel2

java.lang.Object
tic_tac_toe.Agent
tic_tac_toe.AgentLevel2
public class AgentLevel2
extends Agent
Class implementing level 2 of the tic-tac-toe-playing agent, which employs the regular minimax algorithm (a depth-first search strategy for adversarial games) and features a complete adversarial search

A technical description and analysis of this agent is given in the problem formulation report accompanying the source code.

    • evalBestMove

      public Evaluation evalBestMove​(Board b, boolean maximizing, int depth)
      Returns a move evaluation following the minimax algorithm for adversarial, two-player, zero-sum games

      This level follows the standard minimax implementation. The utility values of each leaf nodes are as follows: 100 for a win, -100 for a loss, and 0 for a draw. The minimax values are then backed up the game tree via recursion.

      Parameters:
      b - current board state
      maximizing - true if it is the turn of the maximizing player (agent); false, otherwise (that is, the turn of the minimizing player [human])
      depth - depth of the game tree
      Returns:
      move evaluation following the minimax algorithm
